page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: Although the major part of the area is given over to commercial farming much is being done to preserve animal and plant life. {1.}Farmers using insecticides do not spray the outside 5m of crop fields so that insects can breed to feed the young pheasants. {2.}The C.W.S Estate and Hatley Hall are both planting thousands of trees to replace those lost through age or disease. 4,000 have already been planted at Hatley Hall. {3.}Woods are being coppiced in parts and undergrowth cleared to accomodate the growth of wild plants. {4.}Some woodlands are being left to accomodate the herds of deer. {5.}Deer shooting is not allowed on either estate. {6.}The Hunt is restricted to certain areas.
